sections.title: Section 1: Logit, Probit, and Linear Classifiers

questions.question: What is a key difference between logit and probit models for classification?

options.A: Probit cannot be used for binary outcomes
options.B: Logit is only for regression; probit is only for classification
options.C: Logit assumes a linear relation with the log odds; probit assumes a linear relation with the cumulative distribution function

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** What are limitations of logit and probit models when applied to text-based classification?

options.D: Assume linearity between input variables and a transformation of the outcome

questions.question: Why might logit and probit models be less suitable for high-dimensional NLP tasks compared to other classifiers?

options.A: They cannot handle text data at all
options.B: They lack mechanisms for identifying important features or regularizing the model

questions.question: What is a decision tree classifier best described as?

options.A: A model that emulates a flow-chart style decision process

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** What are advantages of decision trees for text-based classification?

options.D: Robbie will give you an A if you use them

questions.question: **(Hard, Select all that apply):** What are common drawbacks of decision tree classifiers?

options.A: Highly prone to overfitting if not pruned
options.B: Can be biased by unbalanced data
options.D: May require setting a minimum impurity threshold for leaves

sections.title: Section 3: Naive Bayes and Stochastic Gradient Descent

questions.question: What is the main assumption behind a Naive Bayes classifier?

options.D: Features are conditionally independent given the class label

questions.question: **(Hard, Select all that apply):** What are strengths of the Naive Bayes classifier for text classification?

options.C: Computationally efficient and andles high-dimensional data well

questions.question: What is a key limitation of the Naive Bayes classifier in practice?

options.A: The conditional independence assumption is often violated
options.B: It cannot be used for spam detection
options.D: It is only suitable for regression tasks

questions.question: **(Hard, Select all that apply):** Which statements about stochastic gradient descent (SGD) are correct?

options.A: It is an optimization process, not a classifier itself
options.B: It is only used for neural networks
options.C: It is very fast and can incorporate regularization
options.D: It updates parameters using one random observation at a time
